pages:
March 15, 2021
Fred Baker II
Jackson County Youth Center
930 Fleming Avenue
Jackson, MI 49202
RE: License #: CO380201204
Jackson County Youth Center
930 Fleming Avenue
Jackson, MI 49202
Dear Mr. Baker:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
3/7/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10209 Resident report.
(1) A written resident report shall be completed 30 days after
admission and every 15 days thereafter for each resident in a
detention or shelter care facility. The report shall include all of the
following:
Two of two youth files did not have an initial resident report completed within 30 days of
admission.
R 400.10211 Resident release report.
When a resident is released from a detention or shelter care facility,
all of the following shall be documented: (c) Medical and dental
services provided while in residence.
Eight of eight released youth files did not have a summary of medical and dental services
provided while in care at the facility.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
Not applicable. This is a non-contracted facility.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
Not applicable. This is a non-contracted facility.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance during this review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The CAP, approved 7/14/20, was a result
of the 6/18/20 interim review. The citation was due to the agency not documenting
that policies and procedures were reviewed with youth when they entered the facility.
During this review, it was observed that a new form had been developed to document
this procedure. The facility was found to be in compliance in this area and continues
to follow their CAP.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
March 12, 2021
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 15, 2021
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
